definition: to put on (an article of clothing)
to wrap oneself in : take on sense 3a
examples: the donning of new and more tyrannous moralities

definition: a head (see head entry 1 sense 6a), tutor, or fellow (see fellow sense 5) in a college of Oxford or Cambridge University, a college or university professor
examples: she didn't want to be a don's wife and live in Oxford forever

definition: river 1224 miles (1969 kilometers) long in Russia in Europe flowing southeast and then southwest into the Sea of Azov
